text: Pours a dark brown with little head that does leave ample lacing; bourbon and fruitcake and toffee on the nose; alcohol present to a string degree in the palate. Definitely a sipping beer. Superb.
Draft. Pours dark brown. Sweet stone fruit (plum) with some brown sugar notes.

Wow. Complexity and smoothness in a strong ale. Wow. It's pretty close to perfect. 13.4% alcohol is hard to believe given smoothness.

On tap at Warrens Ale House. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark brown with ruby highlights. Minimal head which dissipated immediately. Booze, dark dried fruit and burnt cane sugar are the central aromas. Sweet with little to no bitterness and plenty of alcohol to balance the sweetness. Long fruitcake finish. Quite lovely.
Pours purplish red very little head. Strong aroma of malt, oak booze. Caramel, rum raisin and some yeast. Pretty good
pours a viscous dark brown with a thin mocha head. Aroma of dark fruit, raisins, dates, caramel and coconut. Taste follows, smooth, silky and sweet
Backlog z Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Ciemne owoce, bourbon, wanilia, sporo alkoholu, karmel. Bardzo dobre.

On tap @ MBCC 2017. Semi-clear amber with thin off-white head. Nose is oak wood, dark dried fruits, caramel malts, bourbon. Nose is moderately sweet malts. Dried fruits, raisins, dried dates. Lingering sweet, warming finish. Yummy.

Dark brown color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted sweet malt, oak, vanilla, dark fruit, & coconut; Flavor of sweet malt, oak, yeast, dark fruit (notably figs), molasses, caramel/toffee, some chocolate, and spice; Warm boozy finish; Nicely balanced & complex; Supercharged quad - very good!
Sample @ Mikkeller Beer Celebration 2017, Blue Session 20170512. Dried fruity, caramely, sweet, sweet finish.

Tap ar MBCC 2017. Pours clear dark amber. Aroma of dried fruits, toffee, chocolate, candy. Fairly sweet. Balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

650ml bottle pours a deep amber color with finger of off-white head that leaves some spotted lacing on the glass. Aroma is bourbon and alcohol with some hints of caramel and dark fruit notes. Taste is bourbon and alcohol with a light spicy hop bitterness and a caramel malty sweetness. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall, a bit too much bourbon on the palate, but still a quality brew that is sure to please many.
2014 bottle shared by a friend. Pours dark brown with a thin tan head. Aroma of malt, caramel and soft fruit. Malty and caramelly flavor with a sugary and boozy finish.

Bottle (2016 Vintage); pours dark brown with a khaki colored head; sweet aroma of brown sugar, molasses, caramel, and hints of wood and malt; taste is also sweet with molasses, brown sugar, caramel, and some traces of wood, malt, and leather; finish is dry and sweet with booziness, very good

RELEASE 2016; 11.6% abv.: Pours deep purple brown opaque, haze with long lasting beige creamy head. Aroma: intense malt notes which takes on toasted toffee, milk chocolate, rye bread, burnt sugar, molasses, clove, tobacco, dark fruit, resins like esters, vanillin, oak, bourbon...flavor is practically tge same. All ingrediends are perfectly incoporated in a great unit. Finish is slightly dry, body is thick, texture is velvetly, almost creamy, carbonation is moderate medium.

22 ounce bottle into chalice; 2016 vintage, bottled on 4/19/2016. Pours fairly hazy/cloudy deep ruby red/brown color with a 1 finger dense khaki head with great retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass. Aromas of raisin, plum, fig, date, cherry, apple, caramel, brown sugar, toffee, molasses, brown bread, vanilla, coconut, bourbon, and toasted oak; with lighter notes of banana, pepper, clove, chocolate, tobacco, leather, and yeast/oak/toasted earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of fruity/earthy yeast, bourbon barrel, and dark/bready malt notes; with good strength. Taste of big raisin, plum, fig, date, cherry, apple, caramel, brown sugar, toffee, molasses, brown bread, vanilla, coconut, bourbon, and toasted oak; with lighter notes of banana, pepper, clove, chocolate, tobacco, leather, and yeast/oak/toasted earthiness. Light yeast and bourbon/oak spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark fruits, caramel, brown sugar, toffee, molasses, brown bread, vanilla, coconut, bourbon, toasted oak, and yeast/oak/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/earthy yeast, bourbon barrel, and dark/bready malt sweetness; with a nice malt/yeast/oak spiciness balance, and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Slightly drying from bourbon/oak spiciness as well. Medium carbonation and medium-full body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/silky, and lightly sticky/chalky/grainy/tannic balanced mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden; a mild warmth lingering after the finish, with zero barrel booziness. Overall this is an outstanding barrel aged Quadrupel style. All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/earthy yeast, bourbon barrel, and dark/bready malt sweetness; very smooth and dangerously easy to sip on for the huge ABV. Awesome barrel balance/integration with the base beer; and well rounded yeast/malt complexity. A highly enjoyable offering.
A: Deep dark brown coloured with a offwhite lacing N: Coffee, caramel T: Caramel, hint of figs, caramel O: Sweet and thick!

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2017 On Tap at Station House, Forest Hills. Pours deep brown, murky, tan head. Aroma is bourbon, chocolate, oak, leather, slight Belgian esters, some toffee, caramel, solidly complex. Flavor is Belgian esters, raisins, dark fruits ala Belgian quad, bourbon, woody oak, chocolate. Really nice barrel aged quad. I?m glad I read that it started out as a quad and sort of morphed into this because that?s the only way to explain this one I feel. Really nice.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2017 650 ml bottle thanks to T.J. 2015 vintage. Color is murky dark brown/ black. Dissipating head. T.J made me sample this blind at first..... Aroma is Caramel, coconut, toffee, bourbon, brown sugar, and the lightest oak. 
What a way to settle up on 2016. The best brew I have had all year. Strong and good. Initial sweetness gets balanced out by yeast, and a huge barrel character. Coconut flakes, chocolate, dates, figs. Bourbon character is here with a strong flavor but not a strong alcohol presents. Drinks more like an 6 or 7% beer. Body is full but NOT syrupy or overly sweet. Gosh damn, the construction of this beer is silly good! If you cracked this fresh... you are an idiot. Wait at least a year to open this. This will age for years to come. Absolutely awesome!

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2016 Poured from bottle hazy dark fruit tan head. Aromas of caramel malt dark fruit toffee and vanilla. Taste is caramel malt toffee vanilla dark fruit and bourbon. Wow. Such an amazing beer.
Light to medium roast aroma, cone hops and light sugars. Desk born to black. Tan head and to bubbs. Touch of heat, thick viscosity mouthfeel a sipper for sure. Extremely enjoyable.

Shared 22 oz. bottle. Pours almost black with a beige head. Aroma of sweet malt, caramel, booze, and oak. Similar taste, with additional flavors of leather, molasses, and dark fruits. Finish is sweet and boozy. Could use some aging.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2017 Draught at Elizabeth Station, Bellingham, WADark brown color. The aroma is mild, but the flavor doesnt leave room for doubt. This is like drinking Christmas pudding, plenty of raisins and rum; there must be some bourbon or oak aging too; the alcohol presence is evident.Excellet sipper.

On tap at Elizabeth Station. Pours a dark brown with no head. Aroma is bourbon notes, dark fruits, candy sweetness. Taste is dark fruits, candies, some boozy notes, high level of sweetness. Quite boozy stuff, oversweet, not very full-bodied, despite high alcohol content. Still good, though.

Dark mahogany color with tan head. Aroma is really complex with lots of caramel, fudge, bourbon, brown sugar and oak. Taste starts with caramel and brown sugar, a slight molasses note, bourbon and finishes slightly bitter. Medium body, quite sticky and syrupy, low carbonation. A really complex beer with nice dried fruits, bourbon and barrel character.

Aroma: oaky, sweet and boozy; Appearance: black amber with thin white head that dissipates slowly; Taste: follows nose with good level of complexity; buttery with lots of molasses and sugar; Palate: heavy body with long, sweet finish; Overall: intense and slightly cloying; very good but definitely not for every day.

Dark mahogany pour with a cream colored head. Oily lacing. Aroma is sweet molasses, wood, bourbon, and dates. Taste is caramel, bourbon, vanilla, dates, and wood. On the sweet side but not cloying. Some boozy warmth. Medium body.

Bottle. Pours an opaque murky reddish brown with a quickly fading light brown bubbly head. Aroma is of bourbon, dark fruits, raisins, figs, vanilla, peaty. Taste is of dark fruits, raisins, figs, hint of blackcurrant and liquorice, peaty, sweet bourbon finish. Sticky oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.
At Hopishop 2016. Aroma of caramel, vanilla, raisin and red fruit. Flavor of caramel, raisin, some coffee, booze, oak, red fruit and molasses. Great flavor bomb.

Pours a clear copper color with a 1/2 inch foamy khaki head that fades to an oily film on the top of the beer. Small dots and streaks of lace drip back into the remaining beer on the drink down. Smell is of malt, brown sugar, caramel, toffee, and banana. Taste is of malt, brown sugar, sticky toffee pudding, and bananas covered in caramel. Awesome flavors on this one. This beer has a good carbonation level with a crisp and smooth mouthfeel. A very good barleywine with lots of complex aromas and flavors.

650ml 2016 bottle, pours a Dark brown colour with a nice beige head. Nose is lots of brown sugar, honey, raisins/dates. Mmmh a full bodied mouthfeel, sweet and complex on the palate. Flavour of raisins, honey, brown sugar. Yum!

On tap at the Venice taproom. Ruby to deep brown with a generous half-inch head, solid retention and terrific lacing. Strong resinous hops aromas with dark fruit and a tinge of caramelized sugars and burnt toast. Big hoppy flavors hit hard up front, supported by caramel, dark fruit and toffee notes, then the hops bitterness returns. Warming alcohol throughout. Medium body, well-carbonated, and a strong bitter finish. Terrific beer, and very intense. Not for the faint-hearted. Also bought a bottle to put away for a while.

On tap at Brewers Republic. Dark, opaque brown, with a medium, bubbly, tan head. Th aroma is brown sugar, overripe banana, coconut, almonds, caramel, and cardamom. Very sweet, with a nice little touch of bitterness and a hint of esters. Heavy body, creamy, spicy and sharp, with a lively and smooth feel. This is a wonderfully complex and smooth, if seriously strong, beer.

Bottle [label says "2015 vintage, no. 002"> @ home. Opaque dark brown color, medium sized beige head. After drinking half the glass the color appears dark red-brown. Aroma is malts, toasted malts, molasses, bourbon. Taste malts, bourbon, molasses, brown sugar, toasted malts, wood, oak, sweet. Light to moderate alcohol burn in the finish, but totally suitable for this kind of beer. Full body, thick oily texture, suitable carbonation. Absolutely delicious, absolutely awesome. I forgot who sent this to me but huge thanks to one of my trade partners. Absolutely superb!

Pours a dark cola brown with a tan head. Coconut, vanilla, oak, and sweet date on the nose. Thick without being viscous with some alcohol heat coming late. Coconut, oak, and sweet date flavors. Some chocolate toward the finish.

Only the second Belgian quad I have ever had, but man, what an impression. I get to the hint of coconut amongst the layers of syrupy/candy sweetness in the candi sugar and brown sugar. A pleasant alcoholic warming effect on its way down.

The fact is a great beer this is .. Rich .. Rich .. Abv is perfect and valuable .. Mouth is a caramel bear spraying .. Booze is very well done .. Its a delight. I need glasses so I dont beat my children. If I had them my punches would connect better and there wouldnt be so many people "talking"

Pours deep mahogany into a trappist glass. Tan head with little retention quickly recedes to hug rim. Sweet molasses and bourbon aromas. Thick with dark molasses covered pit fruit and tobacco upfront turning to hot coconut in the lasting sweet finish.

650ml bottle, 2016 vintage. (11.6% ABV) Pours a clear dark ruby-brown with a thin, tan head that dissipates to an outer ring leaving spotty lacing. Sweet aroma of roasted malt, caramel, dried fruit, bourbon, molasses, oak, vanilla and coconut. Sweet flavour of molasses, brown sugar, dried fruit, caramel, roasted malt, vanilla, oak and tobacco with a bourbon warming finish. Full body with a smooth, oily texture and soft carbonation. Lots of complexity. Excellent... a world class ASA.
Fantastic! A well rounded blend with brown sugar, Coca Cola like attributes in appeance and aroma. Bourbon on the backend. Slight warming carbonation. 2016 vintage.

Bomber. Dark brown pour, almost opaque, thin off-white head. Nose is malty and sweet (it smells like a chocolate malt more than a beer). Mouth is medium-full, oily and sweet, malted milk balls, chocolate, brown sugar, a touch of barrel and ABV warmth. It was hot and muggy so I shared this (was more of a cheap watery lager night weather wise), but I had a hard time finishing this. Ive had several of these limited BA editions from FW and while Ive really enjoyed a few of them, this one was a serious disappointment. They claim this was suppose to be a Quad, instead they made a milkshake. Wayyy too sweet and wayyy overpriced. Dont believe the star-struck hype.

Clear ruby pour with a thin beige head .... Aroma of brown sugar, candi sugar, dark fruity yeast think plum .... Taste is of coconut, brown sugar, candi sugar, dark fruity yeast, tobacco and molasses.... Has some boozy spirit flavors .... roasted and caramel malts .... Finish is malty with mixed coconut and booze .... Dark fruity yeast lingers as well .... Has smooth qualities and a nice malty mouthfeel ... Considering the abv its hidden well

Bomber. Clear ruby brown with a small tan head that lasts in a ring and laces. Aromas of bourbon, molasses, brown sugar, caramel, coconut, wood, plum, raisin. Flavor is bourbon, molasses, caramel, brown sugar, plum, raisin, light coconut, and wood. Medium plus bodied, smooth and oily with a slightly dry and hot end.
Malt Sweet complex smoking maple syrup Carmel barrel complexity sweet whiskey notes

On tap at Lunar Brewing Co. as part of the 2014 batch, viscously dispensed to a snifter showing a black/brown hue that exposed a hint of ruby highlighting as the liquid diminished, a modest layer of tan head foam that expeditiously reduced to a ring, with some dots & dashes of lacing. The nose was malty & sweet, with esters as prune & concord grape, hints of cocoa, and barrel induced vanilla & coconut. Full bodied, with a syrupy texture, and low carbonation that contributed a little spritz to the palate, the taste expressed an even sweeter presence of caramel, dark brown, almost burnt sugar, and molasses, along with some earthy bitterness, and alcoholic warmth. As a rich, after dinner sipper, but a little too close to cloying for me.

Draft @ CBC 2015. Pours a dark amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty toffee aroma. Sweetish malty spicy oaky toffee caramel flavor. Has a sweetish malty spicy toffee caramel finish.
Drank at the BBQ in Waalwijk 10-7-16. Awesome quad. Very thick and rich. Lots of bourbon in the taste, very rich sweetness. Love it.

Picked up this bomber a year ago. Split 2 ways at fridge temp.

A - Pour is a dark brown but looks pretty much like molasses in the glass. 2 finger tan head that faded to a thin line.

S - The aroma is really nice. Vanilla, molasses, syrup, ginger, honey, coconut and spices.

T - Well Firestone Walkers barrel program continues to impress. Its thin at first but then this bouquet of flavors erupt. Vanilla, coconut, woody undertones with sweet toffee, chocolate, tootsie roll and pie crust. its sweet, not cloying and the ABV is so well hidden. No way this is a 13% beer.

M - Thin up front, dense finish with a very mild carbonation

O - Exceptional beer. Wish I had enough to age for a few years.

Bottle, 2015 vintage. Very dark brown pour with a slight ring of tan head. Wonderful aroma of sweet Belgian quad, fruity yeast and brown sugar... complimented by the barrel treatment. Lots of bourbon barrel taste, but very mellow and smooth. Only faint quad elements remain... super smooth and rich sweet bourbon and molasses flavors. Decadent.

(Firestone Walker Stickee Monkee) Bottle 650 ml at home, vintage 2015. Served into a snifter, ABV 12.5%
Dark brown colour on the body, one full finger of thin, beige head on top, with average retention.
Nice aroma with lots of dark fruits and malts, a hint of caramel, toffee, some spices even, plums, molasses.
Very sweet taste, almost cloying, with caramel, toffee, red and dark fruits, plums, notable alcohol, hints of chocolate, toasted malts, wood, dates.
Thick body with good carbonation.
Great beer.

On tap at Meridian Pints 6th Anniversary pours a murky, sticky brown with some clumpy, white head. Nose is cool, plenty of spice, clove and anise, booze, vanilla, caramel, heavy malt, nougat. Flavor is all the same, chewy nougat and brown sugar, caramel, malt, vanilla, whiskey, wood pulp, clove, anise, some pepper too. Sticky finish. Solid.
Caramel, toffee, bourbon and chocolate notes all over this. Strong aromas. Sweet tasting, very little head when poured. Delicious.

2016 batch. Pours dark brown with a fair bit of a quickly evaporating tan head. Smells sweet, with notes of molasses, fig, raisin, plum, caramel, and bourbon. Taste is sweet, with lots of chocolate, dates, fig, toffee, and leather. Feels very smooth, lightly carbonated. This is far more reminiscent of a barleywine than a quad but its still really great.
Purchased at Bevmo, Sunnyvale, Ca. Its good.. The sugar is there definitely ... But its not overbearing.. A little molasses , alcohol well hidden, a tasteful treat, well done.

22oz bottle to a snifter. Pour is a nice dark brown color, think khaki head. Nose is huge banana, resin, more light fruit, malt. Taste is medium-heavy body, sweet with some tartness as well. Finished so clean. Amazing beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2016 vintage. Dark reddish brown, with a thick, but rapidly dissipating head, and no lace.  Lots of things going on in the aroma; dark fruits, raisin, molasses, oak, leather, brown sugar. Flavor was not quite as complex, but still tasty. Oak up front, then sweet rum soaked raisin, candi sugar, molasses, leather. A little boozy heat. Sweet and sticky, but has some oaky dryness on the finish.
Very dark pour from a bottle at a friends house while playing poker. Lots of dark fruit in the aroma and the flavor. Good quad. Tasty.
2014. Dark red brown. Big aroma brown sugar, whiskey. Super sweet. Toffee insane caramel. Slight milky caramel.

Deeper reddish-brown, very light reddish head. Toffee, honey. Light tobacco. Quite sweet. Lighter bitterness. Lots of alcohol, quite heavy, oily. Quite long finish. Excellent.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Type: 22-oz. bottle
Glass: Karl Strauss 26th anniversary tulip glass
From: Trader Joes in Santa Barbara, Calif.
Price: $13.99
Purchased: May 23, 2014
Consumed: March 26, 2016
Misc.: 2014 vintage

To say Im excited to review this one might be the understatement of the millennium. Picked this up awhile back with Rachel at Trader Joes. It was the last one available and I had never heard of it. I tried a taster of it on June 11, 2015 at Blind Lady Ale House and gave it a 4.5 on Untappd and just wrote: Taste. Wow. I dont have any recollections of flavor and anything else, so this will be from scratch. 

Poured a mahogany color with two fingers of khaki-tan, rocky head, which dissipated rather quickly. Average spotty lacing on the sides of the glass. Average retention. (Sight - 3.75)

Smelled big whiff of boozy bourbon right away, followed by oaky wood, Belgian candied sugar, coconut flakes, vanilla, dried tobacco and toasted brown sugar. Hidden behind the booziness is some fig, dates and raisins, more leathery tobacco and sugary caramel. (Smell - 4.25)
 
Tasted just amazing. Instantly remember how good this thing was. Got smoother bourbon than the nose, but still boozy, warming all the way down to my legs. Also Belgian candied sugar, sugar cane, oaky wood, leathery tobacco, toasted brown sugar, maple syrup, sweet caramel, boozy chocolate syrup, vanilla, coconut flakes, plum, fig, dates, dried raisins and cocoa. (Taste - 4.75)

Full body. Sticky texture. Lively carbonation. Long, boozy, warming finish. (Feel - 4.75)

Loved this one. Havent put together the overall ratings, but might be the best Firestone beer Ive ever had. Battling neck-and-neck with Sucaba. (Overall - 4.75)

4.57 100 A+

(bottle) slightly hazy deep amber colour with a frothy light-beige head. aroma of heavy coconut and dill, good quality marzipan, some milk chocolate, dark toffee, fudge and cherry schnaps. flavour is mostly caramel and milk chocolate, very sweet, with lots of earth, some notes of treacle and a light ethanol numbness on the gums in the finish. heavy-bodied with soft carbonation.

Murky dark brown color with tan head. Aroma is yeasts, candied sugar, raisins, plums. Taste is sweet candied sugar and plums, very low carbonation. Thick and viscous. Good, but Belgians are way better at making strong dark beers fruity in a non-candy way.

From bottle at BKL München 2016.
Dark brown body, with a tiny head.
Aroma of bourbon, barrel, melting dark chocolate, caramel, cocoa, dark fruits, subtle liquorice, some alcohol.
Taste follows this, with some more tea notes, more booze and very dense and creamy.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes alcoholic, warm, medium dry, medium roasty, medium sweet, with chocolate, cocoa, liquorice, wood, bourbon.

Very tasty. Especially the taste is really dense and complex, with wonderful layers of dark malts and barrel notes. A bit too much alcohol presence for my liking though, but that was to be expected. Not my favourite FW beer, but another high class barrel aged strong ale.

Poured into a snifter. 2015 vintage.

3.25 A: Dark brown, almost black color. Less than one finger of short lived, fizzy beige head formed. No lacing left.

Stickee Monkee 15 vintage

The beer pours a hazelnut brown color, with brighter ember hints in it. Yields a small, fizzy head, which wont rebuild after excessive swirling. 

The nose offers a tremendous amount of Bourbon soaked oak, spicy, warm, full of coconut and earth mingled vanilla. This gets coated up by rock sugar, toffee and caramel, exhibiting a profound sweetness, gently balanced by the multi layered barrel. The nose finds an additional layer in roasted, warm nutshells, licorice and wild honey.

Drinks with just the required amount of carbonation, subtle, yet well accentuated, preventing the beer from sticking to the tongue, keeps it going with a lot of nuances becoming detectable on the palate. Provides a silk, not overly thick body, ensuring the sugar rush to maintain enjoyable.

Tastes of earth coated, melting toffee, a subtle spiciness, more earth and a nice roast quality, enriching the malts. As the Bourbon gets introduced to the palate, more spices unfold, entangled into rock sugar and a pleasant, slick coffee dryness. While this produces a rich sweetness, it does by no means overpower the beers overall taste profile, tamed and enriched by the well pronounced Bourbon. Finishes with a noteable bite within the otherwise complete silk mouthfeel, representing a warming, still enjoyably balanced Bourbon peak. A dry spice bitterness represents the introduction to the beers finish, with rock sugar and melted toffee remaining detectable, showcasing a clean, yet appealing ending.

This may be the most complex, well nuanced sweet beer Ive ever had. At first, Ive been disappointed by its thinner mouthfeel, then I started to undertand its benefits. The palate reacts more sensitive to peppery Bourbon, the utmost silk mouthfeel and changes within the malt sweetness, without becoming sticky or cloying. Nontheless, this is still a sipper, a pleasant one though.

Bottle shared at Struise shop Brugge. Dark brown with a ring off white head. Aroma of butterscotch, toffee, caramel, brown sugar, oak and sweet overripe dark fruit. Flavour is light heavy sweet. Medium to full bodied with light carbonation.

Bomber 2014 vintage poured a clear redfish brown with a small lasting creamy tan head. Aromas of toffee, fruitiness, bourbon, light molasses and light oak. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of toffee, bourbon, dried fruit, light oak and a hint of molasses with a smooth lingering bourbon toffee finish.

Bottle @ Steasys. Thanks for sharing! Deep amber pour. Small head. Aroma is pretty rich and toasty. Generous caramel. Molasses. Charred grains. Full, fat body. A bit of oaky booziness. Hot, but not difficult to drink. Generally sweet. Oily. Good.
One of the best beers I've ever had. The balance between sweetness, complexity and barrel aging is exquisite.

Deep brown with off white head. Super sweet syrup and walnut with a touch of alcohol. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared from McHughs. Pours strong tea brown. Leather, toffee, Apple, molasses, oak, chocolate, caramel, rum, tannin, spice. Flavour is sticky toffee, caramel, wood, oak. Alcohol warmth on finish. Sticky dessert raisin rum finish. Great.

On tap at CBC15. Dark brown with off white head. Aroma is dark fruits, brown sugar, bourbon, vanilla, oak and sweet caramel toffee. Taste has dark fruits, plums, raisins, bourbon, dark sugar, vanilla, wood and alcohol.

Tap at barrelworks, buellton. Dark brown color, smooth head. Rich sweet and roasty nose, chocolate and coffee. Some toffee notes. Sweet body, licorice, toffee, coffee and chocolate. Balanced and rich.

Bottle, little head faded completely, dark brown beer. Aroma raisin, molasses, dark malts, cookies, spice, vanilla. Taste is sweet raisin, brown sugar, dried tart cherries, vanilla, hint of oak, touch of whiskey. Palate is quite rich, but not syrupy, carbonation moderate. Overall this is a big, sweetish beer, but nice on a winter holiday night.

From notes at the Earth Eagle Members Party (10/20/2015). A beautiful mixture of full-bodied malt flavor and a lot of bourbon oak from the barrel. It tastes closer to a barleywine than a Quad, but the flavor is complex with sweet notes of toffee and dark fruits mixing with leather, wood, and whiskey. Lots of barrel aged flavor on this one, but it is nearly perfectly executed.

2015 bottle poured into a tulip glass..burgundy with a medium off-white head..aroma of dark fruits,brown sugar,bourbon,vanilla,oak,toffee..tastes of
plums,raisins,bourbon,brown sugar,vanilla,wood..more of an American
Strong Ale/Barleywine even though technically a quad..little on the sweet
side but real good.

Deep borwn body, tiny brownish head. Marvelous aroma, lots of dried fruits, mainly plum, candy sugar, gingerbread, spicies, liquorice, alcohol... Tast is grat too. Dried plum, alcohol, liquorie, candy sugar, woody notes, dried plum in brandy. Long sweet and warm finish with dried plum... Full body, medium carbo.Great beer.
Bomber shared at Steasys. Dark brown caramel pour. Strong boozy dark fruit aroma. Taste follows. Really good stuff.
Bomber. Dark reddish amber pour with a small dense head. Rich caramel, dark fruit. Boozy but not as much as the ABV would suggest. Slick smooth palate. Excellent!

Pours an opaque dark chocolate brown color with mahogany edges and a two finger beige head that quickly settles into a thick, lasting ring. Surprisingly good retention given its style and ABV with sporadic streaks of soapy lacing left behind.

Sweet, slightly boozy aroma with a nice barrel character thats decently integrated into the leathery malts, dark fruit and sweet molasses/brown sugar notes of the base. Charred oak, toasted coconut and vanila bean along with boozy bourbon and brandy sweetness. Underneath the barrel, theres some leathery tobacco, dark fruit, toffee and caramel. As it warms the sugar really starts to stand out.

Lighter body than expected and not quite as complex as the nose suggests. Again, theres a strong barrel presence but its nicely integrated into the malt, vinous fruit and Mexican sugar flavors. Strong oak presence with a decent amount of dry char and sweet boozy heat. Slightly smokey with leathery malts, tobacco and vinous fruit, notably fig, date, raisin and other dark berries. Toffee, caramel and burnt sugar adding more sweetness. Some boozy heat in the finish but this beer drinks very easy considering the high ABV.

Bottle. Poured a clear amber color with small bubbly khaki head. Aroma was sweet, sugar, raisin, molasses, caramel, oak, roasted notes. Flavor was also very sweet, too rich for me. Molasses and caramel stood out, wood notes, raisins, and bourbon flavors. No alcohol burn, but the flavor was very present and smooth, If this was a little less rich Id have probably liked it more. Full body, slick texture, average carbonation, sweet and smooth finish.

Pours very dark brown with a small tan head. The aroma has toffee, molasses, toasty malt, oak, caramel and huge richness. It has a big rich smooth body with light soft carbonation. The taste starts with rich toasty malt, smooth oak, toffee, minor spice, dark caramel, warning alcohol and light molasses. The finish is smooth oaky and show more alcohol, but fits well with the beer. Great one here.

Bottle. Heavy molasses and dark bread for the malt, light herbs for the hops, light to moderate dough and leather for the yeast, with hints of raisin, date, brown sugar and tobacco. Head is small, creamy, light tan, with spotty and slippery lacing and good legs, and is mostly diminishing. Color is clear very dark brown. Flavor starts heavily sweet and lightly acidic, then finishes moderately sweet and lightly bitter. Palate is medium to full, syrupy with a lively carbonation. Maybe a touch too sweet, but this Quadrupel has excellent depth and complexity.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2017 re-rating 2016 bottle: dark brown pour with a thin tan head that disappears quite quickly. Notes of toasted caramel, candi sugar, tons of bourbon, vanilla, light oak sourness, molasses, some dried fruit and sweet spices. Full body but not thick or oily, with medium carbonation. This is probably a 4.7, but I will keep it at 4.9 because of that phenomenal 2014 vintage I had.

Writing from memory, because I havent reviewed the beer when I had it, 6 months ago, but I just had to say its as close to perfect as a beer can get
2014 vintage. Dark, but not as dark as a stout, with the sweet smell of caramel and bourbon. The taste is amazing, sweet, bourbon-y, with that Firestone Walker-like barrel feel that I cannot describe. The alcohol is undetectable (at least it was for me, but I was well in my cups by the time I had this).
Awesome stuff. 5/5
On tap at tap takeover at blue palms, LA. Sweet and very rich, not dry like the style usually is. Could only handle a small amount. Packs a big warming alcohol punch. Excellent beer.
Really deep taste, you can feel it has been aged in barrels. The alcohol level is very high but doesnt feel more than a standard Belgian triple. Sweet but in a natural way

2015 Release. Pours Brown with a ruby hue and a small light brown head. Head retention is poor. AROMA: drake roasted malt, caramel, molasses, toffee, oak char, herbs, dark chocolate bitterness, alcohol/bourbon, earthy, smoke, slight bitterness, caramelized brown sugar, spices, peppercorn, dark stone fruit and roasty. TASTE: rich malt, dark chocolate bitterness, toffee, caramel, roasty, coffee oil bitterness, caramelized brown sugar, dark stone fruit, chard oak, alcoho/bourbon, molasses, spices, light peppercorn, herbs, slight maple syrup and raisin. AFTER TASTE: toffee, molasses, woody, bourbon and chocolate bitterness with a syrupy finish that coats your mouth.
Bottle shared at Anchorage Sept Tasting: Poured a brownish red with a tan head. Aroma was strong sweet malts and fruit. Taste was sticky sweet with malts, sugars, and very tasty.
Dark brown pour. Nose and taste and burnt brown sugar, booze, and raisins.
From tap at CBC 2015. Hazy amber colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of fruit, malt, alcohol, hops, bread and caramel.

Bottle. Holy crap what a great brew. Im not normally a fan of sweet beers but this one does it right. Nose of molasses, leather and candied plums. Taste features cola, molasses, brown sugar and mixed dark pitted fruits. Palate was lush and sticky with too much sugar. This could probably be used to pour on pancakes in place of syrup. Delicious, but will someone please pass the insulin.
UPDATED: OCT 10, 2015 Draft pour at 3 aces Chicago. Pours dark brown with slight white head. Taste of sweet molasses. Excellent brew!
On tap at Three Aces. Poured black amber with off white head. Aroma sweet sugar date barrel juice. Light carb med bod. Taste quite sweet date barrel

2014 vintage bomber bought at Brew-denell 2015 at Brudenell Social Club. Comes in fancy box, accentuating the beers similarities to an oversized cigar. Vanilla flavoured belts. Sweet, oaky, leathery molasses booze. Spicy peppery taste at first. Lots of oak on the nose. Cantaloupe and autumnal leaves in the aftertaste. Honey. Silky smooth mouthfeel, not very thick. Im not a huge fan of quads, but this still left me impressed.

Phenomenal brew. Been wanting to try this for a long time. Thanks kathouse!! Pours an attractive mahogany. Aromas of banana, coconut, oak, molasses. Flavours are sweet and boozy. More banana, caramel, Belgian candy. Quad like for sure..but with a huge kick. Awesome.
Brown pour with a tan head. The aroma and flavor have a good bit of rum, brown sugar and toffee. Fairly boozy. Medium to thick mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

Strong scents of licorice and molasses. Nice dark color, very thick with a slight purple tint to it. Starting off cold it is very smooth with some great licorice flavors. Will see how it develops as it warms up. I wish I could have aged this for a while, but since I was traveling I had to drink it shortly after purchasing.

Bottle. Awesome aroma. Bananas, molasses, tobacco, butterscotch, figs, black cherry, vanilla and oak. Tastes moderately sweet. Dark fruit, banana, tobacco, vanilla, coconut, light boozy bourbon, caramel, and butterscotch. Medium to full body. Sticky mouthfeel. Great.
Bottle. Pours a dark reddish brown color. Aroma and taste are dark fruits, vanilla, and bourbon.
Very dark brown mostly headless, deep caramel, grape nuts, molasses, sweet, a little heat, a little tack in the feel, still very very good

2015 vintage - from bomber. Wonderful toffee flavor. Big and boozy; should be terrific in a year or two.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Delicious! Dark and very alcoholic though still balanced. Tastes of barrel and bourbon mingle perfectly with roasted malts.

On tap last week at The Mayor Of Old Town. Lighter brown and clear appearance with a light brown head. Rich, malty aroma with notes of oak, vanilla, caramel, light coconut, candy sugar, leather, light molasses, toffee and light fruity esters. Similar flavor, adding a medium to heavy sweetness. Full body, with a smooth creamy feel. Rich and complex. Very niiiice.

Pours thick dark unclear amber with pretty much no head. Aroma is so beautiful like a toffee caramel bar and some sweet malts. The flavor brings big sweet raisins and snd rum and caramel with smooth spice like brown sugar as they did add it.

2015. Bottle to glass. Pours a mahogany brown color with a light tan head. Aroma is mild dark fruits, toffee, vanilla, malty. Flavor is delicious toffee, vanilla, touch of dark fruits. Very nice beer. Super smooth.

22oz bottle (2014 vintage) pours dark red brown with light red edges and small head. Nose is rich caramel, maple bourbon, raisin, some oaky vanilla, nutty earth. Taste is a touch thinner on the palate than expected, bitter semi sweet dark fruits, caramel, vanilla, old wood, some light dark bread. Finishes sweet but balanced, round bourbon dark fruits, maple, charred molasses, light vanilla.
Pours a burgundy red. Aroma is molasses, caramel, burnt sugar. Taste is caramel, coconut, sugar and vanilla. Slighly cloying.

Clearish cola brown, no head. Nose is bullish sweetness and soft yeasty buzz. Sweetness throughout, helps that the initial taste is full on coconut and cola nut buzz. Builds to a more creamy, brassy bitterness. Carbonation is fairly soft but the mouthfeel is fairly dense. Finishes a bit more burnt brass and brown sugar with a more tea-like rich linger. The ABV is laughable hear, maybe tasting sub 10% at most, but rich dessert wine buzz is satisfying throughout. Bottle, Cheers Sir Tadalot, Beers I Hadnt Known Were Gushers Daisy Tasting
Bottle thanks to Tad. Dark brown with tan head. Aroma of vanilla, toffee, coconut, dried fruit, raisins. Similar taste, vanilla, coconut, dried fruit, toffee, molasses. Quite sweet and a little hot

Bottle at Craigs, cheers Tad! Pours clear chestnut brown with a thin white head. Aromas of hazelnut, dark sugars, vanilla. Taste is sweet, sticky, banana, vanilla. Spicy and sweet finish. 

12th July, gusher tasting
Bottle at craigs. Pours deep ruby brown, nose is toffee, caramel, vanilla, light fruit, taste is dry, vanilla, sweet, fruity.
Oak and coconut aromas, a little smoky. Pours thick brown with a minimal head. Sweet and malty flavors with a strong alcohol finish.

Dark ruby red in color. Thin head but seems to hold. Lacing is okay. Strong aroma of cherries. There is some floral notes also. All of a sudden i smell vanilla. Very rich, creamy texture. The finish is very sweet and easy on the palate. Its also a bit salty. Alcohol is hidden very well. I cannot find anything to say bad about this beer. This reminds me of the 14th anniversary beer but better i think. This is by far one of my top beers i have rated thus far. I am glad i bought 2 bottles.
Lord almighty. One of the best of my beer-tasting experience. Lots of toffee, caramelized peach, salt, oceans of it, and rich molasses. A wonder.
Dark pour from 22oz bottle at Jensen park. Brown head. Massive Carmel and sweet taste. Cocoa Carmel milk cream wood and oak flavors. Fantastic

Does not taste like a quad. Very smooth, sweet, and bourbon flavored. Pours like motor oil with a tan head. Smells like bourbon. Had at hoveys party. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours amber with an off white head . Aroma of malt, caramel, some bread, alcohol and bourbon. Flavor is sweet an malty with some warming alcohol, caramel, grains and vanilla. Full body, soft carbonation

A deep mahogany body with ruby highlights sits beneath a slowly fading light khaki, creamy smooth head falling slowly to a thick solid ring

Well integrated and very complimentary with flowing transitions, rich dark fruit, pie crust, fig newton framed in oak and draped in bourbon, underlying complexities of coffee, chocolate cake, molasses, coconut, citrusy spirit notes, cherry, red and blueberry, the spicy quad notes mingling with the spicy spirit barrel... all on a creamy smooth, approaching sticky, medium plus body leading to further blended residuals of the previously mentioned components, an excellent brew and barrel marriage

On tap at Flying Saucer KC

Bomber shared around, thanks bro and/or Harrison! Very exciting to have!! Brownish black pour with little head. Aroma has heavy yeast, a bit of barrel, some sugars. Very layered and textured. Taste is sweet, yeasty, thick. Wow! A tough drinker with a lot going on. 15.2
This is by far one of the best beers Ive had. Its so dark and sweet. It goes down so smooth. I could slowly sip on this all day long, but Id get pretty drunk since this is 12.5%.

CBC. Very dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is malt, caramel, chocolate, bourbon, dark fruits and dark fruits. Flavour is malt, light roasted malts, dark fruits, caramel, medium sweet, chocolate, bourbon, hop with notes of alcohol.

On tap at Slaters 50/50, San Diego.
Bottle (22oz $18): Clear dark brown with small head. Aroma is sweet bourbon. Quite sweet, medium plus body and some warming in the end. Very tasty.

CBC. Hazy brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, dried fruit, dark sugar and alcohol. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish with warming alcohol. 020515

Poured from fresh 2015 bomber, pours a clear very dark brown with a really thin tan head that dissipates very quickly, aroma had a good amount of caramel and malt mixed in with dark fruit and fresh tobacco and leather, flavor has a nice bourbon front end with a dark fruit and malt finish, abv is very well hidden, good stuff.
Draft. Pour is clear brown with a small tan head. Aroma and flavor are loaded with bourbon, vanilla, coconut, and toffee. Heavy and huge but well done. Nice.

22oz bottle. Pours brown with a small tan head. Aroma is of wood, sugar, grain, and alcohol. Taste is of wood, sugar, dark fruit, grain, and tobacco. Lingering oak flavor. After it warms, a lot more dark fruit comes out. The alcohol is definitely present. Mouthfeel is creamy and sticky. Body is sticky and heavily carbonated. This drinks very easy given the alcohol. I enjoyed this a lot.
22oz bottle of 2015 vintage. Pours a dark brown color without much head. Low carbonation, overpowered a little by the spirit flavors.

The smell is complex sweet full of bourbon caramel toffee & malt. The taste is complex as well sweet but not overly so full of bourbon, caramel, & toffee just a great experience. One the best mouthfuls ive personally encountered. This is a fantastic beer that should be enjoyed by all beer lovers. Firestone Walkers best IMHO!
Tap, amber pour, white head, nose and taste are caramel, strong, boozy, vanilla

Tap at brewery tap room. Small pour. Very dark with small head. Strong alcohol and dark fruit nose. Some fig sour. Very rich. Sweet and alcohol prevalent. Finish is very very nice. Intense beer that is very good.

Served on tap at Firestone Walker. Dark black color with no head. Plum and raisin aroma. Creamy thick texture. Molasses and chocolate flavor. Dark fruit with a little spice. Some toasted notes.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap @ CBC 2015. Dark amber with a light brown head. Aroma medium malty (caramel, brown sugar, dark fruits, Bourbon, barrel). Flavor heavy sweet, barrel, llight bitter, lots of alcohol. Almost full body.

Draft. Cranberry-hued, with very little head. Brown sugar, candied raisins and buttery French vanilla in the nose. Very sweet aroma. The beer was formulated to be sweet and malty for blending purposes, and its clear in the flavor. Raisin, fig, grape -- all the dark fruits, left out to ripen. A rough, alcoholic edge lingers on the tongue. Alcohol is intense, tongue-numbing -- I cant feel my tongue -- and blazing thorough the nostrils. Very low, tingly carbonation, medium body. Sweet, boozy and inebriating. A little heavy on the barrel as well as a bit one-dimensional.

Tap at CBC15! Pours a dark, clear amber with a nut brown head. Aroma has lots of bourbon! caramel fudge, dark dried fruits, brown sugar. Taste is sweet with again lots of bourbon, slight fruity. Sticky body, soft carbonation.

Tap @ CBC 2015. Pours dark reddish brown with a small offwhite head. Aromas of vanilla, milk chocolate, dark chocolate, malty sweetness, syrup, caramel. Taste is caramel, fudge, malt, chocolate, vanilla, dry woody notes.

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2015 New rating draught at Stone Escondido during release evening of FW 19. This is magic.
Old rating: 4.2 Draught at CBC 2015, red session, with Ken, Colin and Reuben. Amber beer with a small but lasting head. Fruity vinous a aroma, caramel, raisins, yeast notes, plums, toffee, candy notes. Fruity fig flavor, yeasty, toffee, nuts, slightly spicy, caramel and raisins, warming alcohol. Full bodied, a perfect sipper.

Draught @ CBC 2015. Pours vvery dark brown with a offwhite head, alcings. Aroma of rich malt, caramel, wood, coconuts, candy sugar, alcohol. Flavor is rather sweet, malty, caramel, oak, coconut, sweet dark fruits, wood, alcohol. Medium body, soft carbonation, sweet finish with warming alcohol. Nice and smooth, nicely balanced. 020515
Tap at CBC 2015, Copenhagen. Originally rated 20150502. Colour is clear brown with very small white head. Aromas and flavours: Dark fruits, dry fruits, some sweetness, some alcohol and malts.

Draught @ CBC 2015 [ Red Session ]. - Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2015, Sparta Hallen, Gunnar Nu Hansens Plads 11, 2100 Copenhagen, Denmark [ As Firestone Walker Stickee Monkee ].Clear dark brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, caramel, dried fruit, sugary malt - caramel - toffee. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, dried fruit, bread - wood - coconut, roasted - caramel, light alcohol. @red cbc 2015
full body, complex, medium sweet, caramell, wonderful. you can feel the above but considering the amazing taste it does not matter

From tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2015, Red session. Dark brown color with beige head. Malty aroma, caramel, toffee, chocolate, dark dried fruits, plum, some vanilla and wood. Sweet and bitter taste, caramel and fruity. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Draught at CBC 2015.
Clear orange coloured with a small off-white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of caramel and dried fruits.
Sweet and fruity flavour of caramel and dried fruits with notes of hops.
Sweet and hoppy finish.
From tap. Pours clear and golden amber with a small tan head. Aroma is toffee and caramelish. Sweet caramelish. Toasted. Breadish. Suagr. Dextrose. Lingering sweet finish.
Brown pouring with tan head. Complex malt profile. Some oak but subdued. Some cedar and earthy hops. Finishes with some alcohol warmth. A great strong ale.
Tap @ CBC 2015, red session. Murky brownish pour with tiny lacings. Bourbon, candi sugar, syrup, vanilla and malty sweet
Tap @CBC15. Clear, very drak brown. Small offwhite head. Aroma has coffee, dried fruit, hints of vanilla and booze. Sweet flavor, dried fruit and brown sugar. Warming booze and coffee. Really nice.
sample at cbc. pours very deep brown. aroma has lots of toffee. taste is sweet, some coconut, toffee caramel, balanced.

Deep Brown with off white head. Aroma: lots of barrel character with sweet dark fruits, brown sugar and oaky vanilla. Complex taste with also plenty of barrel character, sweet, raisins, caramel and some warming alcohol. Quite brilliant.

Draught @ CBC15
Aroma has sweet malt, caramel and ripe fruits. Flavour has woody notes, alcohol, woody notes, caramel and ripe fruits. Sweet slow sipper, very American.
Tap at CBC15.. Dark brown.. Thin tan lacing.. Soft sweet toffee.. Light spice toffee malt nose... Sweet caramel toffee.. Soft fruits
Tap at CBC2015. Dark brown color, small brownish head. Toffee, malty aroma. Medium-bodied to full-bodied. Toffeeish, vanilla and light alcohol. Nicely balanced.

Sample @ CBC2015.
Pours dark mahogany color with a small head. Sweet caramel aroma, sweet malts, some hop notes, bready notes too, some molasses and toffee. Very sweet sugary flavor, some toasted malts, toffee, brown sugar and ripe fruits. Alcohol extremely well hidden, sticky sweet palate. Excellent.
6426

Draught @ CBC2015. Pours a dark ruby amber colour with a small head. Aroma of sweet malts, syrup, plums and wood. Rich flavour of toasted malts, syrup, bourbon, tart wood and some complex berry notes. Full bodied. Warming, complex, velvety finish. Great!
Pours clear deep brown with flat tan head. Aroma of butterscotch, nuts, toffee, muscovado. Taste is rich, sweet, butterscotch and muscovado. Body is thick and creamy with soft carbonation.

Grapey, raisiny aromas, caramel, plum, somewhat winey. Dark, almost black, with a fully retaining khaki head. Somewhat sweet, fruity, hints of booze. Full bodied, extremely drinkable, especially weighing in at 13.4%!
Very big, thick and syrupy. Pours very dark mahogany without much head. A fair amount of barrel with doses of candy apple and caramel. Not my cup of tea, way too syrupy sweet. Tap at Churchkey.
Malty bourbony smell. Taste is malt, bourbon, booze, and brown sugar. Mild booze heat, medium body, and some foam.

Tasted from tap:
Nose - light chocolate malt and cognac-like fruits. 
Taste - medium (to slightly above) mouthfeel. The milk chocolate and dried fruit flavors dominate with a tingle on the tongue right up front (like grape skins). After mid palate a malty caramel becomes noticeable and linger long into the finish.

draft at Meddlesome Moth. This style has a wide range of beers this was like non other. Taste was sugars up front - not just sweetness but sugarS...some alcohol and I did get some tobacco at the end - a sipper. less of a beer and more of a drink...

EBF 2015. Une bière brune, légère mousse beige. Un nez bien constitué avec du caramel, de chocolat et ce qui semblait être de la noix de coco. Une bouche sucrée mais pas trop, du caramel. Cette bière porte bien son nom, elle colle au palais et ce nest pas un défaut.

Shared bottle by a friend. 2014 version. Happy to try this one! Poured a darker Brown colour with a non lasting off head. Aroma of dry roasted malts, vanilla, walnuts, butterscotch, oak, plums, caramel, toffee, lots of sugary sweetness, sweet bourbon, this is very enjoyable. The barrel ageing is coming along so Well! Very Nice!

Bottle. Brown pour with a thin tan head. Aroma is lots of toffee and brown sugar, sharply boozy, a touch of dark fruit and bread. Flavour is tons of toffee, almost buttery, some molasses and brown sugar, a slight boozy edge. Wow, very tasty.

Sample @ EBF.

Appearance: Hazy brown with a small bubbly brown head and little lacing.

Aroma: Heavy. Syrup, caramel, bourbon, rich (barley wine-ish), vanilla, and quite a lot of oak. 

Taste: Quite sweet. Vanilla and oak forward, bourbon, toasted malts, spices, fruity notes (figs, raisins).

Palate: Full body. Moderate carbonation. Oily mouthfeel. Residual sugars. Oak/vanilla finish. Warming. 

Overall: Heavy. Tasty, but hard to drink even as a sipper. Lack a bit of balance. Very oaky. Barrel treatment is too present for my liking.

Liquide qui est dans les teintes de brun. La mousse disparaît. Jaime ce genre de nez. Assez riche, chocolaté, caramel, fruits, barrique, des fruits foncés. De la noix de coco? En bouche, cest un régal. Nut brown ale boostée. Encore du carramel et du chocolat à la noix de coco. Fruité vanillé. Chêne. Quad, impy stout, brown ale. Une affaire qui semble aller dans tous les sens mais qui marche en maudit. Cest bon et ce nest jamais trop chaud. Finale pour empêcher de tomber dans la crise sucrée.

Catching up on notes. Tap at Plan 9 Alehouse in Escondido on July 9, 2014 for a Firestone Walker keep-the-glass night. Pours brown with a decent layer of tan head. AROMA of rich caramel, vanilla, sticky oaky bourbon, campfire marshmallows, leathery toasted malts, and port-soaked raisins and plums. FLAVOR is just super rich with bourbon, coconut, remnants of Belgian yeast, sticky dark fruit, port wine, molasses, and brown sugar. Fairly sweet indeed but still far from cloying. The giant ABV is very well concealed. Absolutely delicious stuff. (225, 955)

Sampled at City Beer San Francisco thanks to a kind soul. Pours a dark mahogany brown color with a small khaki colored head. The aroma and flavor have big sweet caramel, Belgian candi sugar, brown sugar, vanilla, oak, dark fruit, raisins, bourbon, tobacco, full bodied, I would like another shot at this.

Pours barely translucent mahogany, thin buff head. Bourbon-soaked wood dominates the aroma but lets roast malt and caramel peek through. Flavor has bold fruity - almost wine-like - woody and bourbon tones plus hints of roast malt and caramel. Texture has good fizz and firmness.

[ Tap ][ 4oz ][ FW Barrelworks ][ $2.50 ][ Tasting Snifter ][ 2.22.15 ]
>> Stickee Monkee. Murky brown pour with weak foam. Nose is intense brown sugar, chocolate chip pancake, Twizzlers, blueberry jam. Taste is rich cookie dough, nicely integrated soft bourbon barrel, big maple and brown sugar dominate. Really nice in small doses and makes an obvious case for adding sugar and body to their anniversary blends. Great finish of spicy brown alcohol and maple.
Brown color. Bourbon aroma and flavor, combined with sweet malt. Drinkable but too much bourbon for my taste. Alcohol is present on the palate.

The beer pours a very dark brown with a motor oil like viscosity. Aroma of toffee, roasted malts and bourbon. Taste is very complex with bourbon, caramel, toffee and vanilla. It has a long sweet finish. Great beer.

On tap at Beer Baron. It pours a dark ruddy brown color with a small light tan head. The aroma has light sweet molasses, rich cherry syrup, plum and leather. The flavor is very sweet in a sugary way up front followed by tons of fig newton, plum, booze, leather and light baking spice. Coconut-like barrel notes near the finish, which is also very sugary sweet. I now see where the anniversary series gets a lot of its sweetness. Theres some really interesting depth of flavor, but unfortunately its covered up by all the sugar. Tasty, but only as a fireside warmer and in small portions.

Bottle... Pours mostly clear and dark with flashes of mahogany and a small, fleeting, white head. The nose is a swirl of caramel, oak, booze and toffee. Full-bodied with a syrupy mouthfeel and stinging carbonation. The flavor is malty and bourbony with loads of alcohol heat. Not painfully alcoholic and even if it was, Im no pussy - bring on the booze. Pleasant, malty, warming, mouth-watering finish. A treat. Bottle courtesy of ctipping!

Dark brown pour. Huge aroma, barrel, dried dark fruit, leather, smoke. Lots going on in the taste, brown sugar, dark fruit, leather, whiskey, smoke. Barrel aging well integrated. Medium to heavy body. Many barrel age but few do it as good as fw

Bottle. Dark brown, some ruby hints. Tan head quickly fades to zilch. Massive alcohol wallop at first: bourbon, oak, some brandy I think? Not unlike an old fashioned cocktail. Raisin, coconut, toffee, molasses. Surprisingly light mouthfeel, nice alcohol heat cutting through the richness. Finishes with a huge raisin note, warming whiskey. Kind of all over the place, but quite good.

22 oz. bottle, pours a deep dark mahogany with a very small tan head. Nose is very complex, with notes of dark dried fruits, caramel, treacle toffee, lots of bourbon and vanilla. Flavour is just as amazingly complex, with loads of elegant bourbon barrels, caramel, treacle toffee, dark dried fruits, and brown sugar. Sweet, but no where close to cloying. Incredibly complex and elegant. What an outstanding sipper.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2015 On tap at Beer Junction, 2015 Barrel Junction event, also bottle several months later. Been wanting to try this for few years. Dark pour, small head, light carbonation. Aroma of rich, dried fruit, toffee and chocolate. Flavor is dried fruits, especially raisins, little chocolate, hints of tobacco and leather. Not deeply complex, but enough to be interesting. Maybe pushing the envelope for me on sweetness. Nice brew.

Bottle split at Bruces pad, with thanks to the host with the most, 28/11/14.
Mahogany brown with a decent khaki covering that soon dissipates to edgework.
Nose is dark fruit rinds, coconut shavings, sticky toffee pudding, light booze fumeage, coco powder, light spice.
Taste comprises toasted brown sugar, dates, sweet licks, toffee fudge, raisens, dark fruit peel, light hop presence, prunce juice.
Full bodied, viscous, smooth on the palate, sweet close.
Decent strong if a little overly sweet, could do with a bit more bitterness to raise the balance for me.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Draught. Pours a mostly clear dark brown color with a small tan head on there. Nose has some booziness to it with caramel and wood coming through. Taste is sweet and woody, and feels pretty smooth. The coconut in here didnt bother me as much as I thought it would.
22 ounce bottle. Pours reddish brown with a decent beige head. Aroma of fruit, malt, caramel, and bourbon. Taste is dark fruit, malt, caramel, bourbon, and wood. Sweet for sure. Nice.

Tap
Minimal aroma I thought. Pours a very dark brown, almost a molasses color. Superb taste, sweet flavor and strong hints of bourbon and vanilla. Fantastic flavor that drinks very smoothly despite being quite boozy at 13.4%.
Hoping to find it elsewhere.

Draft at Beer Authority, Seattle. Heavy black, small foam. Big sweet barrel aroma, complex sugars. Quite sweet and smooth, rich alc warms this up. Reasonable balance, and it is tasty. Alc is well integrated. A bit sticky with sweetness.

Bottle since my wife says I no longer buy enough Belgian styles, well here ya go Hun. Pours ruby brown, small khaki head that disappears. Nose has a nice barrel presences. Taste is generally sweet with plum, cherry, vanilla, oak, bourbon all to nice levels, medium to full body. Mouth feel is sticky.
Poured on tap at GS1221. Thick, rich, and seriously flavorful. So thick, it just slides down slowly. I wish I could drink more. Surprisingly easy to drink.
Bottle, brown sugar color with minimal foam, very hot and boozy, brown sugar and bourbon left in the barrel, hot heavy finish

Bomber. Super sugary nose, brown sugar, rich fruit, lots of barrel. Dark translucent brown with ruby highlights. Massive rich fruity sweetness, vanilla, sweet dark fruit is prominent. Really absurdly complex. Thick body but flows smoothly through the palate. Tickles the tongue with changing flavors. Hides the alc. so well. Great!
Bottle. Nose of vanilla, chocolate, caramel, toffee. Sweet, tart flavor, tofee and fruit, rich somewhat soda-like but very delicious.
A quad/IS experience. Chocolate malt, very good sippability despite higher abv. Very good barreling.

Aroma: raisins, Oak, Sweet Bread

Appearance: Brownish Hue, Passes Mild Light, Off White Head Ring, Some Lacing

Taste: Oak, Sweet Bread, Raisins, Mild Molasses

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Sweet, Mildly Boozy

A quite fantastic beer. Deep, sticky and rich all the way through. Just enough carbonation to keep it from being too dense. A good amount of vanilla and booze comes through. This is a really well mellowed beer.

Bottle shared by MannyGoldberg - cheers Padraig. Thick dark brown, minimal head. Sweet dark dried fruit aroma, figs, toffees, caramel, some booze - very Christmassy! Thick, syrupy palate, medium carbonation. Masses of chewy malt and toffee flavour, caramelised nuts, some licorice, raisins, fig rolls, long vanilla finish. Very nice.

(Bottle, Stockholm Beer Festival, 26 Sep 2014) Dark reddish brown colour with frothy, beige head. Malty, vinous nose with notes of dried fruit, caramel, port wine, vanilla, oak wood and hints of bourbon. Malty, fruity, vinous taste with dried fruit, caramel, treacle and a slightly vinous finish with a certain bitterness and some fiery alcohol. Full body, thick and syrupy mouthfeel. Quite sweet. Complex with lots of flavours coming through. Possibly too strong and too sweet, but I cant help liking it. Very nice.
On tap. Bold on aroma, bold on flavor, and certainly bold on alcohol. This brew has it all. Unfortunately, I dont like the balance so much. It also tastes a little too sweet to me.
22oz bottle pours a hazy brown with an off white head. sweet malt bourbon and caramel taste
bottle, wayyyy to sweet for me. The barrel aging is phenomenal as usual, but the beer itself was giving be diabeetus.

Bomber. Dark mahogany colored in appearance with a sudsy layer of light brown foam. Strong notes of dark fruits, coconut, caramelized dark sugars and toasted oak in the aroma. The taste is a blend of candi sugars, caramel malt and cherry tobacco upfront along with some molasses, vanilla and bourbon in the finish. Mouthfeel is thick and syrupy with soft carbonation and more sweet dark fruits and burnt sugars in the finish. The overall flavor goes back and forth between a Quad and a barrel-aged English Barley Wine. Extremely complex and potent.

Bottle shared in London - thanks to Bruce! Pours clear caramel-brown with a creamy tan head. The nose has lots of ripe fruits, some brown sugar, bread, toffee. Hugely sweet flavor with lots of creamy caramel, vanilla iced cream, rich brown bread, dates. Full bodied with fine carbonation. Finishes warm and sticky with lots of gooey ripe fruits, dates and figs, more creamy caramel and toffee. Great stuff overall.

Bottle thanks to Bruce. It pours darkest brown with a small beige head. The nose is rich, roasty, dirty, dark fruit, charred wood, treacle, molasses, wood, candy sugar and vanilla. The taste is rich, deep fruity action, warming booze, berry, spice, caramel, burnt cake, earth and wood with a dry, warming finish. Full body and fine carbonation. Punchy, but somehow remains drinkable. Not too shabby at all.

Bomber bottle. Aroma is sweet with coconut and bourbon. Appearance is a dark brown with no head. Taste is bourbon forward. Almost hard to taste past the booze, but I also get tobacco and some Belgian yeast. Palate is oaky. Overall, a good, strong beer that could have been blended better.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22oz bottle in a taster glass. Pours brown with a beige head. Aroma of some caramel and toffee malts, some oak and alcohol and bourbon, some sweetness, and some light spices. Flavor the same with a nice blend of everything. Smoother texture. A very solid beer.
Super nice. Smooth, sublime, complex. The toffee notes are amazing and whats this beer in my eyes.

19/X/14 - 1Pt. 6Fl. Oz. bottle @ Beuks postponed Firestone Walker and other nice beers allowed as well tasting (Brussels) - BB: IV/18/14 (2014-1230) Thanks to beuk87 for sharing the bottle!
Clear deep purple brown beer, creamy beige head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: sweet, bourbon, sugary, caramel, hint of banana, raisins, dried fruits, alcohol. MF: soft carbon, full body. Taste: sweet banana, sugary, lots of bourbon, sticky stuff yes!, vanilla. Aftertaste: sugary, sweet, caramel, alcohol, vanilla, bourbon, bit of banana. Good stuff!

Pours like a whiskey. Tastes a little like one too. Sweet caramel aroma with toffee and brown sugar. The taste is whiskey like with oak, caramel, sugar. This is a sipping beer. On tap at Pinocchio's. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Smells of greatness. Vanilla oak.bourbon. Aftertaste of strong vanilla semi awkward but great beer

Bottle shared at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Pours brown to red with a beige head, aroma of chocolate, bourbon, coconut, roasted coconut, vanilla and wood, flavor of chocolate, bourbon, coconut, vanilla and wood, full bodied.

September 25, 2014. Bottle at SBWF. Pours dark hazy chestnut brown with a tiny off-white head. Aroma is figs, raisins, dark bread, bourbon, vanilla, oak. Taste is lots of sweet dried fruits, bourbon, caramel with a light bitterness and light roasted notes. Finish is sticky caramel with a light bitterness. Smooth medium to full bodied, creamy texture, soft carbonation.

October 21, 2014 - bottle at Beelows. Dark brown pour with limited head. Aroma was dark fruit, sugary sweet, and alcohol / bourbon. Taste was very much like a bourbon barrel aged barleywine mixed with a belgian quad. Started out with some caramel, then moved into the sugary sweetness. The alcohol slowly crept in to balance the sweetness and finished with a slightly spicy tobacco flavor. There was also a nice woody oak component that became noticeable when the alcohol set in. Overall very well done, but just a touch too sweet for me to get into the mid 4s; however, makes perfect sense when used for their anniversary blends.

22oz bottle. Poured a dark brown, almost black color with a smaller sized tan head. Brown sugar, chocolate, caramel, wood, bourbon, vanilla, and dark fruits. I found the alcohol content to be well hidden.

650 ml. bottle sampled @ Firestone Walker Tasting. Thank you! 2014 Vintage. Best beer of the tasting. Pours a ruby dark brown, little mocha head. Nose is pure bourbon goodness, super thick exotic sugar, vanilla, oak, candy sugar, very sweet caramel malts. Taste is similar, thick bourbon, vanilla, exotic sugar, brown sugar, candy sugar, sweet oak, sweetness coating your mouth, nicely warming, cinnamon. Body is not particularly thick but works well-enough. Awesome.
Pours black with no head. Aroma is bourbon, malt, caramel, brown sugar. Taste is more bournon, great stuff. Maybe a bit too onedimensional but I love it.

Bottle at home. Deep Brown with off white head. Aroma: lots of barrel character with sweet dark fruits and sugar. Oaky and vanilla. Complex. Taste: plenty of barrel character, sweet, raisins, caramel, some booze! Really solid stuff. Cheers!

Drucken på ölmässan, Nacka strand. Lite väl mycket av allt, kort sagt. Hög klass, men väl söt och allmänt belgiska toner.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle thanks to Justin. Poured into snifter. Deep Brown with red highlights. Minimal off white head. Nose is boozy with caramel and toffee. Taste is very sweet and sugary with a moderate vanilla character. Leaves sugar on your lips and a slight warming in your chest, but damn is that 13.4% smooth. light fruitiness as it warms. Much velvet, so smooth

Bottle shared at the End of History tasting. Aroma is brown sugar, chocolate, vanilla, and dark fruit. Pours beep brown and slightly flat with a nice brown lacing. Taste is heavenly: vanilla, molasses, fudge, dates, bourbon, and toffee. Mouthfeel is nice and malty with a sweet sticky ending. Nothing too sweet or sticky but certainly a treat. Just perfect.
Sticky indeed. Thick and syrupy in a good way. Bourbon, molasses, dark fruit.

On tap at World of Beer. Appearance: slight white head, clear, dark brown color. Aroma: raisins, molasses, heavy cereal. Palate: full body, light alcohol burn, oily texture, soft carbonation. Taste: heavy sweet raisins and malt. Overall, amazing beer! The alcohol is well hidden for the percentage, but it is still there enough to give a kick, love the malty smoothness of this beer. Amazing.

Bottle from SJ. Sampled with Dennis Bell. Beautiful notes of brown sugar, bread, candy, wood, dark fruit / raisin, and toast. The finish was sweet, but not overly, smooth enough to hide the high alcohol content. Left my palate with an Earthy, cigar and chocolate flavor. Excellent The only area that needed a boost was the aroma.

@ SBWF 2014: fantastisk stor och het doft och smak av malt och frukt samt alkohol. En mycket grym balans. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark cola brown with crimson highlights. Toffee, bourbon, oak, vanilla. Sweet and thick, with bourbon leading the way. A touch of maple syrup. Warming alcohol finish. I wouldnt be able to pick this out as a quad. Solid.
Bottle at home. Pours dark brown with little to no head. Aroma of whiskey and malt. Thick mouth feel. Tastes like candy, rum, wood and alcohol. Very good.
Not much aroma...but oh well well...everything else was great...malt caramel, some oak toffee and really nice palate.

Bomber bottle from Scott, thanks uhm Scott. Poured a deep blackish super deep tootsie rool brown with a smaller to possibly average sized head of large fizzy foam beige bubbles. Aroma is the best part, bourbon, barrel, bad banana, yeast, softer caramel, molsasses, toffee, vanilla,. Flavor is the same but with a slight bit more syrupyness that really makes this beer work. Awesome stuff.

on tap @ bier30. Wonderful sugar aroma with malt tinges. Sugar sweet with a heavy body, like drinking a complex dark sugar candy bar. The ABV is well hidden. I want this beer, in my belly...... outstanding. Buy it when you see it!
22 ounce bottle thanks to Dismembered_MC. Big sticky slightly sugary molasses dark bourbon vanilla beer. And tasty too.
On Tap at Bier:Thirty Boise. Clear mahogany with a slight wispy head. Awesome oak and caramel malt flavor and aroma. Smooth brandy like palatte. Terrific.

Deep brown pour. Small amount of tan head. Falls quick. No lacing. Vanilla and dark fruit nose. Some raisin and dates as well. An almost whiskey note. Taste is a bit boozy up front with the nose coming through. Some molasses notes.
Sample at SBWF 2014. Dark with a small head. Roasted malt, bourbon, caramel, some alcohol, dried fruit and wood. The mouthfeel was thick and the aftertaste long. A tasty one.

SWBF 2014. Pours a dark brown with a low tan head. Swirling it around leaves some nice lacings. Aromas of caramel, raisins, roasted almonds, butn sugar and bourbon along with some faint leather and tobacco notes. Taste is caramel, raisins, roasted almonds, bourbon and burnt sugar with some ripe apples and soy towards the end. Aftertaste also carries some subtle bourbon and oak notes. Mouthfeel is smooth with some oil and sticky textures. Very very good!
